sentences: Tööd on nii palju, et puhkamisest ei saa juttugi olla.
Ta vaatab mind oma kollakashallide külmade silmadega, ja teretamisest pole juttugi.
Meil oli hea juttu eile õhtul.
context: In Estonian, 'juttu' is the partitive singular form of the noun 'jutt', which means talk or conversation. It can be used to refer to a discussion, story, or conversation in general. The word often appears in phrases like 'ei saa juttugi olla' (not even possible to talk about something), indicating that something is completely out of the question.
